children: Selected images from a nuclear perfusion single-photon emission CT stress study. Normal perfusion is indicated by orange to white coloring, whereas poor perfusion is indicated by purple to blue coloring. Short-axis views (
) show a radiotracer defect in the septal, anterior, and inferior walls that is filled on the rest images. Long-axis views (
) demonstrate anterior, apical, and inferior filling defects with stress (
). These findings are consistent with reversible myocardial ischemia.
